text: Sir Henry Morgan (c. 1635–1688) was a Welsh privateer and Admiral of Caribbean Fleet; Lieutenant Governor of Jamaica 1675–83. Henry Morgan may also refer to: * Henry Coke Morgan Jr. (born 1935), U.S. federal judge * Henry Morgan (merchant) (1819–1893), Scottish-Canadian (Quebec) department store tycoon * Henry Morgan (humorist) (1915–1994), American radio and television personality * Henry Morgan (1915–2011), original stage name of an American actor who changed his name to Harry Morgan * Henry James Morgan (1842–1913), Canadian civil servant and author * Henry Morgan (bishop) (died 1559), last Roman Catholic Bishop of St David's, Wales * Henry Sturgis Morgan (1900–1982), American banker and co-founder of Morgan Stanley * Henry Sturgis Morgan Jr. (1924–2011), United States Navy Rear Admiral and lawyer * Henry Morgan (minister) (1825–1884), author and Methodist minister in Boston, Massachusetts * Henry Morgan (of Llandaff) (died 1632), Welsh politician who sat in the House of Commons in 1601 * Henry Morgan (priest) (1871–1947), Archdeacon of Bangor * Henry Morgan (cricketer) (1907–1987), Irish first-class cricketer * Henry Morgan (Master of Jesus) (1830–1912), English academic ==See also== * Harry Morgan (disambiguation) * Henry Morgan-Clifford (1806–1884), British Liberal Party politician
title: Henry Morgan (disambiguation)
